sub_title: Gobernanza de la Innovación y el Conocimiento | Innovación Inclusiva | Políticas de Innovación
summary:
I am a PhD in Governance of Knowledge and Innovation from the University of Twente (The Netherlands). I hold an MSc in Public Policy from the Universidad Nacional de Colombia and a MA in Economics and Law from the Universidad Externado de Colombia. I got a bachelor’s in government and international relations from Universidad Externado. I worked as an advisor in the Legal Advisory Office, the Directorate of Innovation and Business Development of the National Planning Department, and the Directorate of Regulation of the Ministry of Commerce, Industry and Tourism. From there, I have worked in Public Policy Analysis, Law and Economics, Economic Regulation, Industrial and Productive Development policies, and Quality Policy. I was a fellow of Colfuturo and the Universidad Externado de Colombia. I’m currently a titular professor and a research professor in the Innovation and Impact Unit of the Faculty of Finance, Government, and International Relations. My research interests focus on: 
•	The study of innovation policies and their transformative potential from the actors’ roles 
         perspective.
•	The analysis of just transitions to sustainability. 
•	Conceptualization and implementation of Inclusive Innovation processes; productive development 
          policies.
•	The processes of democratization of knowledge through the social appropriation of Science, 
         Technology, and Innovation. 
•	The Governance of Science, Technology, and Innovation in the Global South.
